intro: Crotalaria praecox, commonly known as the early cowpea or yellow burr medic, is an annual legume native to Africa. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive, spiny seed pods that contain kidney-shaped seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in agricultural systems for soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
